TopicTitle: Space Shuttle Pack for ksp 1.0.4 dev thread

Articles.Content:
> 
> Hi.thank you for the time to comment.
> I am aware of the eva glitch. I need to edit it in the modeling program but have been so busy.
> 
> Aerodynamics have been tricky and has been the biggest issue here.
> 
> It has been modified so much to correct it and I feel it is mostly ok.
> 
> In order to get it right we can do 2 things.
> 
> I can make a patch which modifies its aero. My best guess.
> 
> this means downloading patches and getting feedback from users for a better new version. 
> 
> Or if you are willing you can adjust it to how you think it should be or what works better.
> 
> thats if you are willing to edit the configuration text file.
> 
> I usually dont have much time to actually play ksp unfortunately.

Thanks for the response. If others feel that the aerodynamics are fine, then I guess I need to learn to fly the thing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). If anyone out there has had success regularly landing the shuttle, I could use some suggestions on a good descent profile. I've tried several approaches:

1) From a 100km orbit, lower my periapsis to 45 km to be to the east of KSC. During descent, I maintained a pitch angle of 30 degrees to bleed off speed. Once I get near about Mach 4, I start pitching the nose down more towards the horizon to stop horizontal speed bleed off (usually near the mountains west of KSC) to hopefully glide in the rest of the way, but once I get about Mach 1.5-2, is when the shuttle rapidly loses horizontal speed and I start dropping out of the sky. Also, using TAC fuel balancer, I tried dumping my remaining monoprop to various amounts to see if that helped any, but I noticed no change in reentry.

2) I found this video on Youtube:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RTGVz5-xCWM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
 (warning, audio is loud). Not conventional compared to the real thing, but it worked for that person so I figured I'd try it. Well, since the reentry is steep, my shuttle just goes \*poof\* due to heating. Tried mimicking it exactly, but it doesn't work for me (person may be using lower heating setting). Edit: watching again, they are using an older version of CSS since their shuttle isn't one part.
By the way, my physics settings are all stock settings, except I lowered the conduction factor per Starwaster to alleviate random part overheating, so my aero should be working as expected. No DRE and no FAR installed. Anyways, any suggestion would be appreciated!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-27T15:52:07Z" title="07/27/2015 03:52  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 27, 2015</time> by stevehead**

Hi! First of all, the textures on this looks INSANE man, GREAT work.

I have a rather frustrating problem though.. Almost every piece is overscaled for me.. I've tried uninstalling RSS and RO, but still the same. Anyone else stumbled upon this or is it just me that's doing something wrong?

I figured it was that I needed some tweaktool, but that didn't seem to do it either..

After disabling all the mods I got it to work.. Just have to find the right one now.

Thanks for the mod though, it looks freakin wicked! =)
